intro: Dryadella krenakiana, commonly known as the Krenakian dryad, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a velvety texture.
